nodes.bodyText: is fat.timeout always guaranteed to be set? May want to default to some high number if unset

Instead of this code, we can use p.waitFor(long timeout, TimeUnit units) which was introduced in Java 8. Now that we no longer have to support Java 7 we can use this new java 8 method. If p.waitFor(long,TimeUnit) returns false (i.e. the timeout was reached) then we can report a failure and IIRC the relevant logs will be automatically included
instead of catching an exception here you can use System.getProperty("fat.timeout", "10800000") where the 2nd param is the default value if no sys prop is found
Lets just include the last 5-10 lines of the output file no matter what, instead of special casing it for the last lines containing certain words.
Last 7 line will be included in all cases. Special cases will be left in.
I think we should remove this line and just let the test blow up with the soft timeout regardless of what keywords were found in the last few lines of the output

We need to leave this line in as we will need to revert back to default behavior if we can not read/open the output file. However, the behavior has been changed so that as long as we can read/open the output file the soft timeout will be used and our custom timeout message will be used.
does each line of mvn output have a \n char at the end already?
Checked locally and it appears there isn't \n included when using nextLine()
